snippet: The ruling Islamist Renaissance Party said that it had yielded control of the ministries of justice, interior and foreign affairs, bowing to a central demand of several opposition parties.
abstract: Tunisia's Prime Min Ali Laareyedh announces new cabinet, handing over key ministries previously headed by members of ruling Islamist party to independent figures in effort to calm worst political crisis since country's revolt.
lead_paragraph: The ruling Islamist Renaissance Party said that it had yielded control of the ministries of justice, interior and foreign affairs, bowing to a central demand of several opposition parties.

headline.seo: To Ease Crisis, Tunisia Includes Independents in New Cabinet
headline.main: Tunisia Includes Independents in New Cabinet
